DownloadManagerProxy * mpProxy

Detailed Description

The download manager is a system service that handles long-running HTTP downloads.

Clients may request that a URI be downloaded to a particular destination file. The download manager will conduct the download in the background, taking care of HTTP interactions and retrying downloads after failures or across connectivity changes and system reboots.

Instances of this class should be obtained through gaia::core::Context#getSystemService(String) by passing gaia::core::Context#DOWNLOAD_SERVICE.

Apps that request downloads through this API should register a broadcast receiver for ACTION_NOTIFICATION_CLICKED to appropriately handle when the user clicks on a running download in a notification or from the downloads UI.

Definition at line 50 of file DownloadManager.h.

int64_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::addCompletedDownload ( const base::String &  title,
const base::String &  description,
bool  isMediaScannerScannable,
const base::String &  mimeType,
const base::String &  path,
int64_t  length,
bool  showNotification 
)

Adds a file to the downloads database system, so it could appear in Downloads App (and thus become eligible for management by the Downloads App).

It is helpful to make the file scannable by MediaScanner by setting the param isMediaScannerScannable to true. It makes the file visible in media managing applications such as Gallery App, which could be a useful purpose of using this API.

Parameters:
titlethe title that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
descriptionthe description that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
isMediaScannerScannabletrue if the file is to be scanned by MediaScanner. Files scanned by MediaScanner appear in the applications used to view media (for example, Gallery app).
mimeTypemimetype of the file.
pathabsolute pathname to the file. The file should be world-readable, so that it can be managed by the Downloads App and any other app that is used to read it (for example, Gallery app to display the file, if the file contents represent a video/image).
lengthlength of the downloaded file
showNotificationtrue if a notification is to be sent, false otherwise
Returns:
an ID for the download entry added to the downloads app, unique across the system This ID is used to make future calls related to this download.
static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_BYTES_DOWNLOADED_SO_FAR ( ) [static]

Number of bytes download so far.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_DESCRIPTION ( ) [static]

The client-supplied description of this download.

This will be displayed in system notifications. Defaults to the empty string.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_ID ( ) [static]

An identifier for a particular download, unique across the system.

Clients use this ID to make subsequent calls related to the download.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_LAST_MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP ( ) [static]

Timestamp when the download was last modified, in System.currentTimeMillis() (wall clock time in UTC).

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_LOCAL_FILENAME ( ) [static]

The pathname of the file where the download is stored.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_LOCAL_URI ( ) [static]

Uri where downloaded file will be stored.

If a destination is supplied by client, that URI will be used here. Otherwise, the value will initially be null and will be filled in with a generated URI once the download has started.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_MEDIA_TYPE ( ) [static]

Internet Media Type of the downloaded file.

If no value is provided upon creation, this will initially be null and will be filled in based on the server's response once the download has started.

See also:
RFC 1590, defining Media Types
static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_MEDIAPROVIDER_URI ( ) [static]

The URI to the corresponding entry in MediaProvider for this downloaded entry.

It is used to delete the entries from MediaProvider database when it is deleted from the downloaded list.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_REASON ( ) [static]

Provides more detail on the status of the download.

Its meaning depends on the value of COLUMN_STATUS.

When COLUMN_STATUS is STATUS_FAILED, this indicates the type of error that occurred. If an HTTP error occurred, this will hold the HTTP status code as defined in RFC 2616. Otherwise, it will hold one of the ERROR_* constants.

When COLUMN_STATUS is STATUS_PAUSED, this indicates why the download is paused. It will hold one of the PAUSED_* constants.

If COLUMN_STATUS is neither STATUS_FAILED nor STATUS_PAUSED, this column's value is undefined.

See also:
RFC 2616 status codes
static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_STATUS ( ) [static]

Current status of the download, as one of the STATUS_* constants.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_TITLE ( ) [static]

The client-supplied title for this download.

This will be displayed in system notifications. Defaults to the empty string.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_TOTAL_SIZE_BYTES ( ) [static]

Total size of the download in bytes.

This will initially be -1 and will be filled in once the download starts.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::COLUMN_URI ( ) [static]

URI to be downloaded.

int64_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::enqueue ( const Request &  request)

Enqueue a new download.

The download will start automatically once the download manager is ready to execute it and connectivity is available.

Parameters:
requestthe parameters specifying this download
Returns:
an ID for the download, unique across the system. This ID is used to make future calls related to this download.
static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_BLOCKED ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when the download has failed because of NetworkPolicyManager controls on the requesting application.

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_CANNOT_RESUME ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when some possibly transient error occurred but we can't resume the download.

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when no external storage device was found.

Typically, this is because the SD card is not mounted.

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_FILE_ALREADY_EXISTS ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when the requested destination file already exists (the download manager will not overwrite an existing file).

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_FILE_ERROR ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when a storage issue arises which doesn't fit under any other error code.

Use the more specific ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_SPACE and ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND when appropriate.

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_HTTP_DATA_ERROR ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when an error receiving or processing data occurred at the HTTP level.

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_SPACE ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when there was insufficient storage space.

Typically, this is because the SD card is full.

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when there were too many redirects.

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_UNHANDLED_HTTP_CODE ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_REASON when an HTTP code was received that download manager can't handle.

static int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::ERROR_UNKNOWN ( ) [static]

Value of COLUMN_ERROR_CODE when the download has completed with an error that doesn't fit under any other error code.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::EXTRA_DOWNLOAD_ID ( ) [static]

Intent extra included with ACTION_DOWNLOAD_COMPLETE intents, indicating the ID (as a long) of the download that just completed.

static const base::String& gaia::net::DownloadManager::EXTRA_NOTIFICATION_CLICK_DOWNLOAD_IDS ( ) [static]

When clicks on multiple notifications are received, the following provides an array of download ids corresponding to the download notification that was clicked.

It can be retrieved by the receiver of this Intent using gaia::core::Demand#getLongArrayExtra(String).

static int64_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::getMaxBytesOverMobile ( const core::Context &  context) [static]

Returns maximum size, in bytes, of downloads that may go over a mobile connection; or null if there's no limit.

Parameters:
contextthe Context to use for accessing the ContentResolver
Returns:
maximum size, in bytes, of downloads that may go over a mobile connection; or null if there's no limit
base::String gaia::net::DownloadManager::getMimeTypeForDownloadedFile ( int64_t  id)

Returns Uri for the given downloaded file id, if the file is downloaded successfully.

otherwise, null is returned.

If the specified downloaded file is in external storage (for example, /sdcard dir), then it is assumed to be safe for anyone to read and the returned Uri corresponds to the filepath on sdcard.

Parameters:
idthe id of the downloaded file.
Returns:
the Uri for the given downloaded file id, if download was successful. null otherwise.
static int64_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::getRecommendedMaxBytesOverMobile ( const core::Context &  context) [static]

Returns recommended maximum size, in bytes, of downloads that may go over a mobile connection; or null if there's no recommended limit.

The user will have the option to bypass this limit.

Parameters:
contextthe Context to use for accessing the ContentResolver
Returns:
recommended maximum size, in bytes, of downloads that may go over a mobile connection; or null if there's no recommended limit.
Uri gaia::net::DownloadManager::getUriForDownloadedFile ( int64_t  id)

Returns Uri for the given downloaded file id, if the file is downloaded successfully.

otherwise, null is returned.

If the specified downloaded file is in external storage (for example, /sdcard dir), then it is assumed to be safe for anyone to read and the returned Uri corresponds to the filepath on sdcard.

Parameters:
idthe id of the downloaded file.
Returns:
the Uri for the given downloaded file id, if download was successful. null otherwise.

int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::markRowDeleted ( const base::Array< int64_t > &  ids)

Marks the specified download as 'to be deleted'.

This is done when a completed download is to be removed but the row was stored without enough info to delete the corresponding metadata from Mediaprovider database. Actual cleanup of this row is done in DownloadService.

Parameters:
idsthe IDs of the downloads to be marked 'deleted'
Returns:
the number of downloads actually updated
gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor gaia::net::DownloadManager::openDownloadedFile ( int64_t  id)

Open a downloaded file for reading.

The download must have completed.

Parameters:
idthe ID of the download
Returns:
a read-only ParcelFileDescriptor
Exceptions:
FileNotFoundExceptionif the destination file does not already exist

Value of COLUMN_REASON when the download exceeds a size limit for downloads over the mobile network and the download manager is waiting for a Wi-Fi connection to proceed.

storage::Cursor* gaia::net::DownloadManager::queryN ( const Query &  query)

Query the download manager about downloads that have been requested.

Parameters:
queryparameters specifying filters for this query
Returns:
a Cursor over the result set of downloads, with columns consisting of all the COLUMN_* constants.
int32_t gaia::net::DownloadManager::remove ( const base::Array< int64_t > &  ids)

Cancel downloads and remove them from the download manager.

Each download will be stopped if it was running, and it will no longer be accessible through the download manager. If there is a downloaded file, partial or complete, it is deleted.

Parameters:
idsthe IDs of the downloads to remove
Returns:
the number of downloads actually removed
GAIA_LOCAL void gaia::net::DownloadManager::restartDownload ( const base::Array< int64_t > &  ids)

Restart the given downloads, which must have already completed (successfully or not).

This method will only work when called from within the download manager's process.

Parameters:
idsthe IDs of the downloads
void gaia::net::DownloadManager::setAccessAllDownloads ( bool  accessAllDownloads)

Makes this object access the download provider through /all_downloads URIs rather than /my_downloads URIs, for clients that have permission to do so.
